intro: Crocanthemum greenei, commonly known as the Greene's crocanthemum, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, achene-like seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
